meanings.definition: To combine or group items into a single unit.
meanings.sent1: She is unitizing the toys into a box for storage.
meanings.sent2: The workers are unitizing the products for easier transportation.
meanings.sent3: Unitizing the puzzle pieces made it easier to find the missing ones.
meanings.sent4: He unitized his thoughts into a clear plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: Unitizing the ingredients is crucial for the recipe to turn out right.

meanings.definition: The process of packaging items together for shipment.
meanings.sent1: The unitizing of the goods saved space in the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: Proper unitizing ensures the items reach their destination safely.
meanings.sent3: The unitizing of the gifts made them look like a single present.
meanings.sent4: The unitizing of the books in the box was done meticulously.
meanings.sent5: Unitizing the parcels efficiently is key for the delivery process.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing items into a cohesive whole.
meanings.sent1: Her unitizing of the documents helped streamline the project.
meanings.sent2: Unitizing of the files made it easier to locate specific information.
meanings.sent3: The unitizing of the clothes in the closet made it look neat.
meanings.sent4: Unitizing the tools in the toolbox improved efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The unitizing of the data simplified the analysis process.
